wikipedia_page.main: Lilian Hicks (1853 – 1924) was a British campaigner for the vote for agricultural labourers and later Women's suffrage in the United Kingdom. Hicks took an active role in several organisations and was arrested on Black Friday in 1910.

response: Amy's mother, Lilian Hicks, had been associated with the suffrage cause since Amy was a young girl. They were both members by 1902 of the Central Society for Women's Suffrage and they were soon joining celebrations of civil disobedience in pursuit of their cause. By 1907 they were both in the Women's Freedom League and Amy was serving as a secretary. Amy was imprisoned for three weeks for obstruction that year.

In about 1909 the Women's Freedom League published a postcard which featured Lilian Hicks.Suffragette postcards: real photographic portrait, womanandhersphere.com, retrieved 31 December 2016  She and her mother were arrested on Black Friday in 18 November 1910.
